questions.question: What is the correct way to write the following sentence? Mrs. Smith teach us math this year.

choices.answer: correct as is
taught
teaching
teached

questions.question: In which sentence is the verb used correctly?

choices.answer: Emily have a wonderful dinner last night.
I have lemon cake for dessert tomorrow.
She have chocolate chip cookies for dessert today.
I have brownies for a snack.

questions.question: What is the correct way to write the verb in bold? My uncle have the greatest music collection.

choices.answer: has
correct as is
have
having
Will your mom drive us, or do we have to take the bus?
Will your Mom, drive us, or do we have to take the bus.
Will your Mom, drive us, or do we have to take the bus?
Will your Mom drive us, or do we have to take the bus.

questions.question: The snake slithered across the back porch. What is the best definition of slithered?

choices.answer: stopped
slept
moved
ate

questions.question: Our dog gnawed through the rope, letting him run free in the backyard. What does gnawed mean?

choices.answer: stopped
slept
moved
chewed
words or phrases that help a reader visualize the story
words or phrases that show action
words or phrases to help readers understand descriptions
words or phrases to help readers understand new words

questions.question: Select the correct word to fill the blank?                    Someone has dropped _____ wallet.

choices.answer: his
her
its
his or her
Margaret called their mother to come to the mall.
Bill picked up a new tool for his garage today.
Jose and his friends brought his phones with them.
Kate and Julie packed them backpacks for school.

questions.question: Identify the correct set of homophones from the following:

choices.answer: to, too
there, their
sea, see
all of the above

questions.question: Select the sentence that uses capital letters correctly:

choices.answer: My Cat, Katie, is black and white.
my Cat Katie is black and white.
My cat, Katie, is black and white.
My cat Katie, is black and white.

questions.question: Select the sentence that uses capital letters correctly:

choices.answer: Ann has Dogs, named Hank and Sam, who love the Back Porch.
Ann has Dogs, named Hank and Sam, who love the Back porch.
Ann has dogs named hank and Sam who love the back porch.
Ann has dogs, named Hank and Sam, who love the back porch.
After the class returned from recess, they took a math test.
After the class returned, from recess they took a math test.
After the class, returned from recess they took a math test.
After, the class returned from recess they took a math test.
If you, always eat breakfast you will do better in school.
If you always eat breakfast, you will do better in school.
If you always eat breakfast you will do better, in school.
If you always eat, breakfast you will do better in school.
I like to eat pancakes, bacon and eggs, for breakfast.
I like to eat, pancakes bacon and, eggs for breakfast.
I like to eat pancakes, bacon, and eggs for breakfast.
I like to eat, pancakes bacon and eggs, for breakfast
